questions.question_text: What is the RFC 4627 default encoding for JSON text?

comments.content: Just have google up while you take the test

discussion.content:
What's the point of memorizing this?!
The information can be easily found by googling. What's the point to test in an exam?

Selected Answer: C
According to RFC 4627, the default encoding for JSON text is UTF-8. JSON supports Unicode, and UTF-8 is the most widely used encoding, ensuring compatibility and efficient storage of text data.
Explanation of incorrect options:

A (UCS-2) is a fixed-width encoding for Unicode that is not the default for JSON.
B (GB18030) is a Chinese character encoding and is not used by JSON.
D (Hex) is a representation for binary data, not a text encoding format.

Selected Answer: C
Ref: RFC 4627, page 4

“…
3. Encoding

 JSON text SHALL be encoded in Unicode. The default encoding is UTF-8.
…”

Not sure if this is a CCNA topic?

"Recognize components of JSON-encoded data"

choices.B: Enable the 802.1X option for Authentication Key Management.
choices.E: Enable the CCKM option for Authentication Key Management.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
MAC Filtering lets you manage an allowlist of MAC addresses that can access the LAN. All others are blocked.

Given answer is correct

Can't be B as there are 2 main authentication modes, PSK and 802.1x, questions is asking for PSK, check jeremys it lab day 57 @24:30

Selected Answer: CD
When we select PSK, we give the users a password they can enter to authenticate. This password is Pre Shared Key (PSK). So we can't choose an 802.1x since that uses a cert authentication instead of password.
Mac filtering will allow us to choose who can join and who can't.
Choosing the WPA2 policy is straight forward.

Selected Answer: BC
Answer C is straightforward.
Answer B is correct because, while 802.1X is an IEEE standard, CCKM is a proprietary Cisco technology which requires specific, compatible hardware.
correct answer is BC

Refer to the exhibit. A network engineer is configuring a WLAN to use a WPA2 PSK and allow only specific clients to join. Which two actions must be taken to complete the process? (Choose two.)

questions.question_text:
SIMULATION
-


Guidelines
-

This is a lab item in which tasks will be performed on virtual devices

• Refer to the Tasks tab to view the tasks for this lab item.
• Refer to the Topology tab to access the device console(s) and perform the tasks.
• Console access is available for all required devices by clicking the device icon or using the tab(s) above the console window.
• All necessary pre-configurations have been applied.
• Do not remove any existing configurations from the devices, only those necessary to make the appropriate changes required to fulfill the listed tasks.
• Do not change the enable password or hostname for any device.
• Save your configurations to NVRAM before moving to the next item.
• Click Next at the bottom of the screen to submit this lab and move to the next question.
• When Next is clicked, the lab closes and cannot be reopened.


Topology
-

//IMG//



Tasks
-


Task 1
-

Configure trunks between Sw1 and Sw2 on ports E0/0 and E0/1 using the IEEE standard frame tagging method.

• Add VLAN 99 as untagged on the trunk ports.
• Only extend VLAN 110 and the untagged VLAN across the trunk.
• Verify that PC1 is capable of pinging PC2.


Task 2
-

On Sw1 and Sw2, use IEEE 802.3ad link aggregation.

• Combine E0/0 and E0/1 into a single logical link while leaving the trunk configurations intact.
• Assign number 20 to the link.
• Both links must negotiate aggregation.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct, The default gateway is currently set to Host A's address 192.168.1.1 and this must be adjusted

Selected Answer: C
A. IP address assignment

Host С is using a valid and unique IP address inside its subnet.
Wrong answer.

B. IP network mask

Host С is using the same subnet mask as any other host inside its subnet.
Wrong answer.

C. default gateway

Host С must be configured with the IP address of the default gateway it uses to send traffic to the Internet. This address is 192.168.1.254 (Router A, interface G0/0/0) and not 192.168.1.1 as shown in the exhibit.
Correct answer.

D. automatic DNS

?
Wrong answer.
Given Answer is Correct! The default Gateway should be 192.168.1.254 (Router A G0/0/0 int)

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which configuration parameter is preventing host С from reaching the internet?

discussion.content: wronh answer. It should be Sw4, it has the lowest MAC

Selected Answer: D
SW4 has the lowest priority tied with SW3, but Sw4 has lower mac address than sw3 so we go with D
SW4 is the right answer

Selected Answer: D
In STP, the switch with the lowest priority + MAC address becomes the root bridge. SW3 and SW4 have the lowest priority (8192). Between them, SW4 has the lower MAC address.

The correct answer is D. SW4.

Selected Answer: D
Answer is SW4, lowest Priority, then lowest MAC.

Selected Answer: C
correct answer is sw4, because the lowest MAC

correct
 answer is sw 4
